oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Displacement-based seismic active earth pressure on rigid retaining walls
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHOUDHURY, DEEPANKAR
CHATTERJEE, SANTIRAM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: earthquake resistance
numerical methods
structural design
seismology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For designing retaining walls in earthquake prone region, knowledge of seismic active earth pressure is very important. Similar to the static case, during seismic condition also, the mobilization of seismic active earth pressure depends on the amount and mode of wall movement. Very few researchers have done studies on model retaining walls to estimate the mobilized seismic active earth pressure depending on the mode and amount of wall movement. Based on the available experimental data of earlier researchers, in this paper, a semi-empirical method is proposed that can easily be used in practice to compute the seismic active earth pressure for various magnitudes of wall movements for the walls rotating about the top and bottom. The practical use of the proposed equations is shown through a worked-out example and is compared with the conventional Mononobe-Okabe method.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Electronic Journal of Geotechnical Engineering, USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Electronic Journal of Geotechnical Engineering, Vol.11C, paper No. 660.
